reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights while doing a section of the mare a mare Nord with Sherpa expeditions. We arrived late off the ferry on the first night and its only a 15 minutes drag your cases up the hill to the hotel. (10 minutes on the way down!) They were so organised and welcoming to us. The next day we departed to Corte on the train (again within easy walking distance) Go on the train - it's wonderful! We arrived back a week later for a couple of days relaxing. There are two beaches near by - keep on walking to the far one past the exercise area (Plage Trottel) - it's much cleaner than the main one. The Musee Fesch is well worth a visit, although closed when we went. Plenty of restaurants and bars near by. We ate in the Place Foch area - quite expensive but good sea food. There is a supermarket (Spar) just around the corner on Av de Paris which is the road running opposite Place Foch. A really good pastry shop opposite. Much cheaper to grab a picnic and eat and drink on the beach or in the lovely squares! So you can do Ajaccio on the cheap! Hotel has really good breakfasts - as many pain au choc, croissants, bread, cheese, fruit as you want, and you can probably guess us cheapskates got some for lunch as well. A big bag down to breakfast works wonders! Rooms are small but really clean and the air conditioning is fierce. Bathrooms were fine if not a little quirky but again very clean. Not fabulous views but this hotel is really good value, well positioned for everything, very clean with good staff.
reviews.title: Good value
Parking is a challenge
reviews.text: The Napoleon has one thing going for it -- it is one block from the city center. After that, I am not sure what makes the place so highly rated. The rooms are really small, and the bathroom must be seen to be believed. The tub / shower is one of those European death traps - -you step up to get in, there is no way to sit or recline in the tub (far too small), and, here's the unique feature, the tub bottom is partly humped and partly recessed below the other part. There really is no way to stand in it. The soap they give you is so small that when I dropped it, it went down the drain (no kidding). And the toilet itself -- well -- let's not go into that, but if you are a midget, this is the place for you. There really is no public area of the hotel -- the lobby is small. They do have an elevator (small). The staff is kind, and they have a sense of humor about the whole thing. We had a rental car, and we selected the Napoleon because it has parking. Well, the parking probably was designed by the same guy that designed the tub. The 'Hotel Napoleon Parking' sign on the Course Napoleon ('Main St.' of Ajaccio) should be ignored. It points down a one way street in the wrong direction. Ignore the next street to the west also because that puts you in a very narrow alley that can not be exited. Then take the next street to the West, go two blocks, and turn back toward the airport -- this puts you to the Hotel Napoleon Guarage -- which is unattended, and has a chain across the entrance -- and a microphone where you call the front desk. The lady at the desk tells you that you are in the wrong place, so get back in the car and continue down the street (you can not make a u-turn anyway), and this puts you onto Rue Vero (near to where the first parking sign was), then left into a dead end that is very narrow indeed. No guarage in sight? Not a problem, look at knee level for another microphone and this gets you the same lady at the front desk - who magically opens a guarage door. Hope you rented a small car -- the guarage has a single space, and like everything else, it is small. To get out, well, you are on your own.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel Napoleon is a good value for money. It wasn't cheap, but hotels in Corsica in August are not cheap. The room was not great, a bit tiny, but ok. The people in the reception was very nice and helpful. The hotel is in the centre very close to the ferry and the bus station.
reviews.title: Good hotel for money.

reviews.text: This hotel must have been refurbished lately. The wall coverings, bed spreads, etc appeared to be new. My room was small, but was very comfortable. The windows were new and prevented street noises but the street was quiet at night and one could open the window . I enjoyed the cool breeze so I kept my window open at night. There was an air conditioner but I did not use it. My room was kept quite well by the cleaning staff and fresh linen was put in my bath every day. The TV was new , there was a telephone and the staff was pleasant and helpful. In short, I had a very nice stay. Breakfast was more than enough--three or four kinds of bread, cereal, yogurt, cheese,fresh fruit, juice, coffee (several kinds) and hard boiled eggs.
reviews.title: Good value, convenient to restaurants and helpful staff in this hotel

reviews.text: We booked the hotel on the basis of trip advisor reviews. We arrived very late at the train station where there were no taxis. We called the hotel and they sent a taxi. When we arrived they recommended and organised a good place to eat nearby.
reviews.title: Very helpful staff, hotel clean and warm, rooms functional, good value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel, we arrived at 0745 on Sunday and were immediately able to get into our room. We had asked for a non smoking room with a view and got a room on the non smoking floor with a view of a garden with fruit trees. The bath/shower was interesting but perfectly usable. The breakfast was very good and the staff were especially friendly.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in quiet street
Love Napoleon
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Napoleon Hotel several times - both pre and post refurbishment. The Hotel is exceptionally clean and well maintained and breakfasts are most enjoyable, and relaxing. There are no crowds, queus and mainly couples visit. The views from the front balaconies are a delight i.e. views of the old town rising up the hill are spectacularly bathed in sunlight. The beach private beach and restaurant is not attached to the hotel - but over the main carriageway and a short walk to your right. Because Mention is near the border with Italy, there is a carriageway where traffic can be noisy and scooters race up the mountain road. This added to our 'people watching enjoyment' There are two train stations, one in town, and Garavan five minutues walk to the left, where you can ride to Italy and Monaco , Eze mountain top village etc., in the other direction. Take a local bus (near the main station) up to the hill top villages of Gorbio, St. Agnes (where there is a Maginot Fort and spectacular views) for a few euros. It's hair raising but worth the ride and the views over the bay are magnificient. These villages have excellent, expensive restaurants. Near the Hotel are the Villa Reymar gardens with good views - a lovely walk - uphill.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our stay at the Napoleon. When choosing a hotel for a short stay, I believe that location is everything. On that scale alone, this hotel is tops. The staff are helpful and the hotel very clean. The beds are comfortable and the rooms well maintained. All showers now appear to have good screens on them ( I noticed workmen busy installing them in the remaining rooms) and the heating /air con works well.
reviews.title: A fine choice, splendid location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being on a budget, I did cringe a bit at the €11 breakfast. Still, I bit the bullet and have to say was pleased at the wide range available: good cereals, croissants, bread, cold meats, fresh fruit and yogharts. Enough to keep me going through the day!
reviews.title: central, small clean room, private parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking around Ajaccio at the other hotels, I am sure this was a very wise choice. My only grumble is that there was no computer with internet available to guests. This is increasingly important when one has to register on line for flights and get other travel information.
reviews.title: Small rooms but great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a fine stay. Private parking is a must, even in November. Location is central. Room is small but clean. The bathroom is relatively big, no window and out-dated, but clean. The breakfast buffet was pretty good (fruits, yogurt, teas, hard-boiled eggs, toast ...). The staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Pleasant and private parking great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Napoleon might have liked a larger room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're just back from a perfect few days at the Napoleon. Our spacious room had a balcony overlooking the Mediterranean in front, the Italian coast to the left & the beautiful red ochre Menton architecture to the right. All staff were friendly & helpful & the swimming pool area was a lovely place to relax & cool off. For those not wanting the hotel breakfast (11 euro) there were good options in the vicinity, many of them Italian. Fairly good public beaches are close by & many private ones for extra comfort. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Magnifique!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to the F1 Grand Prix being on in the next town, we assumed there would be no accomodation in Menton; planning to just visit for the afternoon and drive on further into Italy. I asked at the desk on a whim and they asked us to wait 15 mins as there might be a room becoming available. They counted down with us and were almost as excited as us about our luck. The room had a sea view (407) and had recently been renovated with modern and stylish bathroom (shower over deep bath tub), luxery hotel branded toileteries and heated wall length towel racks. The bedroom was mimalist but elegant, comfortable down pillows and doona, a desk, armchair and still room to move. Its greatest asset is ofcourse the view. Extremely convenient location to walk into the old town centre, pick up essentials from the supermarket opposite. We did not use the hotels private beach and restuarant however it looked one of the best beachfront dining experiences in Menton.
reviews.title: Breathtaking view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am loathe to suggest the Napoleon becuase I want to keep it to myself!
reviews.title: AWESOME - except....

likes.liked: — Extremely high standards for the money, private beach (with charge), LOCATION & VIEWS

reviews.title: Excellent hotel
reviews.text: Friendly staff, minimalist but high quality decor, PRIVATE BEACH, fantastic views, fantastic views, fantastic views, fantastic views (do you get it???) you name it. Be sure to have the Napoleon Cocktail when you're there - It's their signature drink and it's delicious!!!
